title: Create PostgreSQL Database

metadata.description: Learn about Create PostgreSQL Database with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Create Database
Inside the RDS service, create a database, either by 
navigating to the Database section,
or just click the "Create database" button:
Settings
Once you have started creating a database, you will be given some choices for the type and settings of your database.
To add a PostgreSQL database to your Django project, choose the following options:
Standard creation method:
PostgreSQL engine method:
Free Tier Template:
Name of database, username, and password
You can choose any name, username, and password:
Keep the default instance configuration:
Check off the storage autoscaling:
It can be a good thing to enable storage autoscaling, but for this tutorial it is not 
necessary.
Grant public access, and create a new security group:
Give the security group a name, we will call it "w3-django":
Keep default db authentications:
Keep default monitoring:
Click Create database:
This will take a few minutes, but when it is finished, you will have a new PostgreSQL database, 
almost ready to run on your Django project!
In the

you will learn how to connect your project to the database.

★
+1

practice_exercises.title: Practice Exercise
practice_exercises.description: Create an example that applies the concepts from this tutorial.

related_topics.title: C Common Pitfalls and How to Avoid Them

quiz.question: What is but for this tutorial it?
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of but for this tutorial it is 'not 
necessary'.

quiz.question: What is but when it?
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of but when it is 'finished'.

summary: This tutorial covers Create PostgreSQL Database concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Create PostgreSQL Database effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Create PostgreSQL Database and how to apply it in your projects.
